name: GoogleAIModel

input.content:
In freecad I want to have a circle but only for reference not to actually be a circle but just so I can line up other lines to make a hexagon for example.
How do I do that?

output:
To create a reference circle in FreeCAD that is not a solid object:

1. **Open the Part Design workbench:** Click on the "Part Design" icon in the toolbar or go to "Workbench > Part Design" in the menu bar.

2. **Create a sketch:** Click on the "Create new sketch" button in the Part Design toolbar or press "Ctrl + N".

3. **Draw a circle:** Select the "Circle" tool from the sketch toolbar. Click on the origin (the intersection of the X and Y axes) to define the center of the circle. Drag the mouse to define the radius of the circle. Release the mouse button to complete the circle.

4. **Set the circle as a reference:** Right-click on the circle in the sketch tree and select "Set as Reference". This will make the circle invisible and non-solid, but it will still serve as a reference for other geometry.

5. **Use the reference circle to align other lines:** Create other lines or sketches in the same sketch or in other sketches. Use the reference circle as a visual guide to align the lines.

**Note:**

* Reference geometry is not visible in the 3D view but can be seen in the sketch editor.
* To toggle the visibility of reference geometry, go to "View > Reference Geometry" in the menu bar.
* You can also create reference planes, axes, and other geometric entities in FreeCAD by following a similar process.

name: WordEvaluator
input:
To create a reference circle in FreeCAD that is not a solid object:

1. **Open the Part Design workbench:** Click on the "Part Design" icon in the toolbar or go to "Workbench > Part Design" in the menu bar.

2. **Create a sketch:** Click on the "Create new sketch" button in the Part Design toolbar or press "Ctrl + N".

3. **Draw a circle:** Select the "Circle" tool from the sketch toolbar. Click on the origin (the intersection of the X and Y axes) to define the center of the circle. Drag the mouse to define the radius of the circle. Release the mouse button to complete the circle.

4. **Set the circle as a reference:** Right-click on the circle in the sketch tree and select "Set as Reference". This will make the circle invisible and non-solid, but it will still serve as a reference for other geometry.

5. **Use the reference circle to align other lines:** Create other lines or sketches in the same sketch or in other sketches. Use the reference circle as a visual guide to align the lines.

**Note:**

* Reference geometry is not visible in the 3D view but can be seen in the sketch editor.
* To toggle the visibility of reference geometry, go to "View > Reference Geometry" in the menu bar.
* You can also create reference planes, axes, and other geometric entities in FreeCAD by following a similar process.
